definitions: adult male deer with antlers, especially a red deer over five years old
man attending a social event without a female companion or partner
investor who buys new share issues hoping to sell them quickly for profit
examples: The majestic stag emerged from the forest at dawn
Hunters tracked the stag through the Scottish highlands
Several stags attended the formal dinner without dates
The wedding reception welcomed both couples and stags
The stag flipped his shares immediately after the IPO launched
Market stags profited from the tech company's public offering

definitions: raised platform in a theater where actors perform for an audience
particular point or period in a process or development sequence
theatrical performance or the profession of acting and theater production
examples: The actors took their positions on the stage
The band's equipment filled the entire concert stage
The project has reached its final stage of completion
Children go through different stages of cognitive development
She devoted her entire life to the stage
His stage career spanned five successful decades

definitions: large horse-drawn vehicle used to carry passengers and mail on regular routes before railways
examples: The stagecoach arrived dusty from its journey across the plains
Bandits robbed the stagecoach carrying gold to Sacramento

definitions: technical skills and artistry involved in theatrical production including lighting, set design, and effects
examples: The director's masterful stagecraft created an immersive theatrical experience
Students studied stagecraft alongside acting and playwriting techniques

definitions: unsteady swaying movement typically caused by weakness, dizziness, or intoxication
arrangement where things are positioned at intervals rather than aligned
examples: His drunken stagger attracted the attention of nearby police
The boxer's stagger showed he was hurt by the punch
The stagger of work shifts ensured continuous coverage
The seat stagger improved visibility in the auditorium

definitions: way a play or performance is presented and arranged on stage
temporary structure of scaffolding used as a platform for workers
organization and execution of an event or complex process in phases
examples: The innovative staging brought new life to Shakespeare's play
Critics praised the minimalist staging of the production
Workers assembled staging to paint the building's exterior
The construction staging surrounded the entire monument
The staging of the military operation took months of planning
Event staging requires coordination of multiple vendor teams

definitions: state of not flowing or moving, becoming stale or inactive
period of little or no economic growth or development in a market
examples: Water stagnation in the pond created an unhealthy environment
The stagnation of air made the room feel suffocating
Economic stagnation plagued the region for over a decade
Wage stagnation frustrated workers despite rising living costs

definitions: mark or discoloration that is difficult to remove from a surface
damage to someone's reputation or character that brings shame or disgrace
dye or pigment used to color wood, fabric, or biological specimens
examples: The wine stain ruined her white wedding dress
Coffee stains covered the old manuscript pages
The scandal left a permanent stain on his reputation
This stain on the family's honor lasted for generations
The carpenter applied cherry stain to the oak cabinet
Laboratory technicians used special stain to view bacteria

definitions: person who applies stains or dyes to materials professionally
device or tool used to apply stain or dye to surfaces
examples: The furniture stainer specialized in antique restoration work
The glass stainer created beautiful church windows
The automatic stainer processed hundreds of microscope slides daily
This wood stainer ensures even color distribution

definitions: process of applying dye or pigment to change the color of materials
biological technique using dyes to highlight structures in microscopy
examples: The staining of the deck took all weekend to complete
Fabric staining requires careful temperature control
Gram staining helps identify different types of bacteria
Cell staining revealed previously invisible structures

definitions: single step in a series forming a way to walk between floors
one of a series of fixed steps forming part of a staircase
examples: She sat on the bottom stair waiting for her parents
The creaky third stair always woke the sleeping baby
Each stair was carved from solid marble
The broken stair posed a safety hazard

definitions: complete set of stairs with supporting framework connecting different floors of a building
examples: The grand staircase curved elegantly through the mansion's foyer
Children slid down the staircase banister despite warnings

definitions: passageway containing a flight of stairs connecting different levels of a building
examples: The emergency stairway provided the only escape route
A narrow stairway led to the apartment's upper floor

definitions: vertical shaft or opening in a building containing stairs and often enclosed by walls
examples: Smoke filled the stairwell during the fire evacuation
The stairwell echoed with the sound of footsteps

definitions: strong wooden or metal post with a pointed end driven into the ground
share or interest in a business, situation, or outcome
money risked on a bet or the prize in a competition
examples: They drove stakes into the ground to mark property boundaries
The tent stakes bent in the strong wind
She holds a significant stake in the technology company
Everyone has a stake in environmental protection
High stakes poker attracted professional gamblers
The stakes were raised to ten thousand dollars

definitions: person or organization with an interest or concern in a business or project outcome
examples: All stakeholders attended the quarterly business review meeting
Community stakeholders voiced concerns about the development project

definitions: situation where further progress is impossible due to disagreement between opposing parties
chess position where a player cannot move without putting their king in check
examples: Negotiations reached a stalemate over salary demands
The political stalemate lasted for months
The game ended in stalemate despite white's material advantage
He forced a stalemate to avoid losing

definitions: main stem of a plant that supports leaves, flowers, or fruit
act of following or pursuing someone stealthily or with harmful intent
examples: The corn stalk grew over six feet tall
She arranged the flower stalks in a tall vase
The victim reported the stalk to police immediately
His obsessive stalk lasted for several months

definitions: person who harasses or pursues someone obsessively and often threateningly
person who hunts game by stealthily tracking and approaching
examples: The celebrity hired security to protect against stalkers
Police arrested the stalker outside her workplace
The deer stalker moved silently through the forest
Experienced stalkers know how to read animal tracks

definitions: pattern of unwanted attention and harassment that causes fear or concern for safety
method of hunting by quietly following and approaching prey
examples: Stalking victims often change their daily routines for safety
Online stalking has become increasingly common
Stalking requires patience and knowledge of animal behavior
The hunter's stalking skills impressed his companions

definitions: booth or stand where goods are displayed and sold in a market
compartment in a stable or barn for housing a single animal
deliberate delay or evasion to gain time or avoid action
examples: The farmer's stall offered fresh vegetables every Saturday
Tourists browsed the colorful stalls at the bazaar
Each horse had its own stall in the stable
The cow's stall needed fresh bedding
His stall tactics frustrated the negotiating team
The senator's stall prevented the vote

definitions: act of deliberately delaying or using evasive tactics to avoid commitment
sudden stopping of an engine or mechanical system due to overload or malfunction
examples: His constant stalling annoyed the committee members
The stalling over contract terms lasted weeks
The airplane's stalling at low altitude proved dangerous
Engine stalling occurred frequently in cold weather

definitions: adult male horse that has not been castrated and is kept for breeding
examples: The black stallion won numerous racing championships
The breeding stallion sired over fifty foals

definitions: person who is loyal, reliable, and hardworking in supporting a cause or organization
examples: Party stalwarts gathered for the annual convention
The team's stalwarts never missed a practice session

definitions: ability to sustain prolonged physical or mental effort without becoming exhausted
examples: Marathon runners need exceptional stamina to complete the race
Her mental stamina helped her study for twelve hours

definitions: small adhesive piece of paper indicating postage payment for mail delivery
tool or device that makes an impression or mark on a surface
distinctive quality or characteristic that clearly identifies something
examples: She collected rare stamps from around the world
The letter needed two stamps for international delivery
The notary used her official stamp on the document
The factory stamp showed the manufacture date
His work bears the stamp of genuine creativity
The incident left its stamp on her personality

definitions: sudden rush of frightened animals moving together in the same direction
sudden mass movement of people driven by panic or excitement
examples: The cattle stampede destroyed everything in its path
Thunder triggered a stampede among the wild horses
The stampede for concert tickets caused several injuries
A stampede erupted when the doors finally opened

definitions: machine or tool used to impress marks or patterns on materials
person who operates stamping equipment or applies stamps
examples: The metal stamper created uniform parts for assembly
This automatic stamper processes hundreds of documents hourly
The passport stamper checked each traveler's documents
Factory stampers worked in shifts around the clock

definitions: way of standing or positioning the body, especially in sports or combat
attitude or position taken on a particular issue or situation
examples: The boxer's defensive stance protected him from punches
Her golf stance needed adjustment for better balance
The company's stance on environmental issues impressed investors
His political stance alienated some former supporters

definitions: structure or piece of furniture for holding or displaying objects
booth or stall where items are displayed or sold
determined effort to resist or defend against something
examples: The music stand held her sheet music at eye level
Plants covered every shelf of the display stand
The lemonade stand earned fifty dollars for charity
Vendors set up stands at the farmer's market
The soldiers made their final stand at the bridge
Her stand against corruption inspired others

definitions: level of quality or achievement considered acceptable or desirable
military or ceremonial flag carried on a pole as a rallying point
established norm, rule, or principle used as a basis for comparison
examples: The restaurant maintains high standards of food safety
Educational standards vary significantly between countries
The regiment's standard led them into battle
The royal standard flew above the palace
Industry standards ensure product compatibility
This procedure became the standard for treatment

definitions: process of making things conform to a standard or uniform format, specification, or quality
examples: Product standardisation reduced manufacturing costs significantly
Language standardisation helped improve international communication

definitions: process of developing and implementing technical standards to ensure consistency and compatibility
examples: Standardization of measurements facilitated global trade
The standardization committee met quarterly to review proposals

definitions: person or thing ready to be used as a substitute or reserve when needed
state of readiness to act or be used when required
examples: The understudies served as standbys for the lead actors
Keep these batteries as standbys for emergencies
Passengers on standby waited hopefully for available seats
The medical team remained on standby throughout the event

definitions: person who stands in a particular place or maintains a standing position
examples: The long stander finally found a seat on the train
Street corner standers watched the parade pass by

definitions: reputation, status, or position within a group or society
length of time something has existed or someone has held a position
position or state of being upright on one's feet
examples: Her standing in the community earned her great respect
The scandal damaged his professional standing
Their friendship was of long standing
The standing agreement lasted twenty years
Standing for hours made her feet ache
The standing position improved his back posture

definitions: tense situation where neither side in a conflict will give way
device or method that maintains separation between objects
examples: The police standoff with armed suspects lasted twelve hours
The diplomatic standoff threatened regional stability
Electrical standoffs prevented the circuits from short-circuiting
The mounting standoffs kept components properly spaced

definitions: particular position from which things are viewed or considered intellectually or morally
examples: From a legal standpoint, the contract was completely valid
The teacher considered each issue from the student's standpoint

definitions: situation or condition in which there is no movement or activity at all
examples: Traffic came to a standstill during the snowstorm
Negotiations reached a standstill over wage disputes

definitions: grouped set of lines within a poem, usually sharing a common pattern of meter and rhyme
examples: Each stanza of the sonnet followed strict rhyme patterns
The poet revised the third stanza multiple times

definitions: small metal fastener used to join papers or attach materials together
basic food item that forms a regular part of a diet
main or principal item that is regularly produced, used, or featured
examples: She removed the staple before scanning the documents
The staple gun made upholstery work much faster
Rice remains a staple in many Asian countries
Bread and potatoes were dietary staples for centuries
Cotton became the region's agricultural staple
Action movies are a staple of summer entertainment

definitions: massive luminous sphere of plasma in space visible as a point of light
famous entertainer or athlete who attracts significant public attention
shape with radiating points typically having five or six symmetrical projections
examples: The North Star guided sailors for centuries
Astronomers discovered a new star in the constellation
The movie star signed autographs for waiting fans
The basketball star scored forty points
The teacher placed a gold star on excellent homework
The flag featured a white star on blue background

definitions: right side of a ship or aircraft when facing forward toward the bow
examples: The captain ordered a turn to starboard
Green lights mark the starboard side of vessels

definitions: white carbohydrate found in plants used as food and in manufacturing
preparation used to stiffen fabric and give it a smooth finish
examples: Potatoes contain high levels of starch
The body converts starch into glucose for energy
The laundry used starch to crisp the shirt collars
Too much starch made the fabric uncomfortably stiff

definitions: state of being famous and celebrated as an entertainer or public figure
examples: Her rise to stardom happened almost overnight
Many actors struggle for years before achieving stardom

definitions: fine particles of matter scattered throughout space from which stars form
magical or charismatic quality that seems to surround famous or glamorous people
examples: Scientists study stardust to understand stellar formation
Stardust contains elements created in dying stars
The performer seemed covered in stardust wherever she went
Hollywood stardust attracted thousands of aspiring actors

definitions: long fixed look with eyes wide open, often expressing surprise, admiration, or rudeness
examples: Her intense stare made everyone uncomfortable
The child's curious stare followed the magician's movements

definitions: high-performance military jet aircraft designed for air-to-air combat
small maneuverable spacecraft in science fiction designed for space combat
examples: The F-104 Starfighter served in numerous air forces
The starfighter intercepted enemy bombers
Luke piloted an X-wing starfighter in the battle
The fleet deployed dozens of starfighters

definitions: marine echinoderm with five or more arms radiating from a central body
examples: The starfish clung to rocks in the tidal pool
Orange starfish decorated the ocean floor

definitions: person who observes or studies stars and celestial objects as a hobby
person who is dreamy, impractical, or constantly lost in thought
examples: Amateur stargazers gathered for the meteor shower
The stargazer identified several constellations
Critics dismissed him as an impractical stargazer
The stargazer spent hours contemplating possibilities
